description: Deletes an existing backup of a table. You can call DeleteBackup at a maximum rate of 10 times per second.

parameters.name: BackupArn
parameters.description: The ARN associated with the backup.

nested_items.name: BackupDescription
nested_items.description: Contains the description of the backup created for the table.

nested_items.name: BackupDetails
nested_items.description: Contains the details of the backup created for the table.

nested_items.name: BackupArn
nested_items.description: ARN associated with the backup.

nested_items.name: BackupName
nested_items.description: Name of the requested backup.

nested_items.name: BackupSizeBytes
nested_items.description: Size of the backup in bytes. DynamoDB updates this value approximately every six hours. Recent changes might not be reflected in this value.

nested_items.name: BackupStatus
nested_items.description: Backup can be in one of the following states: CREATING, ACTIVE, DELETED.

nested_items.name: BackupType
nested_items.description: BackupType:
USER - You create and manage these using the on-demand backup feature.

SYSTEM - If you delete a table with point-in-time recovery enabled, a SYSTEM backup is automatically created and is retained for 35 days (at no additional cost). System backups allow you to restore the deleted table to the state it was in just before the point of deletion.
AWS_BACKUP - On-demand backup created by you from Backup service.

nested_items.name: BackupCreationDateTime
nested_items.description: Time at which the backup was created. This is the request time of the backup.

nested_items.name: BackupExpiryDateTime
nested_items.description: Time at which the automatic on-demand backup created by DynamoDB will expire. This SYSTEM on-demand backup expires automatically 35 days after its creation.

nested_items.name: SourceTableDetails
nested_items.description: Contains the details of the table when the backup was created.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table for which the backup was created.

nested_items.name: TableId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the table for which the backup was created.

nested_items.name: TableArn
nested_items.description: ARN of the table for which backup was created.

nested_items.name: TableSizeBytes
nested_items.description: Size of the table in bytes. Note that this is an approximate value.

nested_items.name: KeySchema
nested_items.description: Schema of the table.

nested_items.name: AttributeName
nested_items.description: The name of a key attribute.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: The role that this key attribute will assume:
HASH - partition key.
RANGE - sort key.

nested_items.name: TableCreationDateTime
nested_items.description: Time when the source table was created.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedThroughput
nested_items.description: Read IOPs and Write IOPS on the table when the backup was created.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: OnDemandThroughput
nested_items.description: Sets the maximum number of read and write units for the specified on-demand table. If you use this parameter, you must specify MaxReadRequestUnits, MaxWriteRequestUnits, or both.

nested_items.name: MaxReadRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of read request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: MaxWriteRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of write request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: ItemCount
nested_items.description: Number of items in the table. Note that this is an approximate value.

nested_items.name: BillingMode
nested_items.description: Controls how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity. This setting can be changed later.
PROVISIONED - Sets the read/write capacity mode to PROVISIONED. We recommend using PROVISIONED for predictable workloads.
PAY_PER_REQUEST - Sets the read/write capacity mode to PAY_PER_REQUEST. We recommend using PAY_PER_REQUEST for unpredictable workloads.

nested_items.name: SourceTableFeatureDetails
nested_items.description: Contains the details of the features enabled on the table when the backup was created. For example, LSIs, GSIs, streams, TTL.

nested_items.name: LocalSecondaryIndexes
nested_items.description: Represents the LSI properties for the table when the backup was created. It includes the IndexName, KeySchema and Projection for the LSIs on the table at the time of backup.

nested_items.name: IndexName
nested_items.description: Represents the name of the local secondary index.

nested_items.name: KeySchema
nested_items.description: The complete key schema for a local secondary index, which consists of one or more pairs of attribute names and key types:
HASH - partition key.
RANGE - sort key.

nested_items.name: Projection
nested_items.description: Represents attributes that are copied (projected) from the table into the global secondary index. These are in addition to the primary key attributes and index key attributes, which are automatically projected.

nested_items.name: ProjectionType
nested_items.description: The set of attributes that are projected into the index:
KEYS_ONLY - Only the index and primary keys are projected into the index.
INCLUDE - In addition to the attributes described in KEYS_ONLY, the secondary index will include other non-key attributes that you specify.
ALL - All of the table attributes are projected into the index.

nested_items.name: NonKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: Represents the non-key attribute names which will be projected into the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: GlobalSecondaryIndexes
nested_items.description: Represents the GSI properties for the table when the backup was created. It includes the IndexName, KeySchema, Projection, and ProvisionedThroughput for the GSIs on the table at the time of backup.

nested_items.name: IndexName
nested_items.description: The name of the global secondary index.

nested_items.name: KeySchema
nested_items.description: The complete key schema for a global secondary index, which consists of one or more pairs of attribute names and key types:
HASH - partition key.
RANGE - sort key.

nested_items.name: Projection
nested_items.description: Represents attributes that are copied (projected) from the table into the global secondary index. These are in addition to the primary key attributes and index key attributes, which are automatically projected.

nested_items.name: ProjectionType
nested_items.description: The set of attributes that are projected into the index:
KEYS_ONLY - Only the index and primary keys are projected into the index.
INCLUDE - In addition to the attributes described in KEYS_ONLY, the secondary index will include other non-key attributes that you specify.
ALL - All of the table attributes are projected into the index.

nested_items.name: NonKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: Represents the non-key attribute names which will be projected into the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProvisionedThroughput
nested_items.description: Represents the provisioned throughput settings for the specified global secondary index.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: OnDemandThroughput
nested_items.description: Sets the maximum number of read and write units for the specified on-demand table. If you use this parameter, you must specify MaxReadRequestUnits, MaxWriteRequestUnits, or both.

nested_items.name: MaxReadRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of read request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: MaxWriteRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of write request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: StreamDescription
nested_items.description: Stream settings on the table when the backup was created.

nested_items.name: StreamEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether DynamoDB Streams is enabled (true) or disabled (false) on the table.

nested_items.name: StreamViewType
nested_items.description: When an item in the table is modified, StreamViewType determines what information is written to the stream for this table. Valid values for StreamViewType are:
KEYS_ONLY - Only the key attributes of the modified item are written to the stream.
NEW_IMAGE - The entire item, as it appears after it was modified, is written to the stream.
OLD_IMAGE - The entire item, as it appeared before it was modified, is written to the stream.
NEW_AND_OLD_IMAGES - Both the new and the old item images of the item are written to the stream.

nested_items.name: TimeToLiveDescription
nested_items.description: Time to Live settings on the table when the backup was created.

nested_items.name: TimeToLiveStatus
nested_items.description: The TTL status for the table.

nested_items.name: AttributeName
nested_items.description: The name of the TTL attribute for items in the table.

nested_items.name: SSEDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the server-side encryption status on the table when the backup was created.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Represents the current state of server-side encryption. The only supported values are:
ENABLED - Server-side encryption is enabled.
UPDATING - Server-side encryption is being updated.

nested_items.name: SSEType
nested_items.description: Server-side encryption type. The only supported value is:
KMS - Server-side encryption that uses Key Management Service. The key is stored in your account and is managed by KMS (KMS charges apply).

nested_items.name: KMSMasterKeyArn
nested_items.description: The KMS key ARN used for the KMS encryption.

nested_items.name: InaccessibleEncryptionDateTime
nested_items.description: Indicates the time, in UNIX epoch date format, when DynamoDB detected that the table's KMS key was inaccessible. This attribute will automatically be cleared when DynamoDB detects that the table's KMS key is accessible again. DynamoDB will initiate the table archival process when table's KMS key remains inaccessible for more than seven days from this date.
